skillTree.localised_description: A Chaos Steed makes a fierce and intimidating mount for any conniving Sorcerer Lord.
As part of the binding ritual, Screamer bodies are flattened and transmuted into unlikely aspects.

During Horstmann's escape from the Pyramid of Light, he managed to free the infamous Chaos Dragon Baudros from its prison, and upon its winged and two-headed form Horstmann took to the sky and fled towards the Chaos Wastes.
The Warriors of Chaos are the playthings of Gods and given many gifts, including formidable fighting skills.
The followers of Chaos need not to rest, they march on with iron hearts desperate to harvest souls.
This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice - a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.
With just a wave of the hand, projectiles fired at this servant of Tchar are turned from sharp and pointy to soft and entirely harmless.
When enemies gaze into the eyes of insanity, insanity has a way of gazing back.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

skillTree.localised_description: "I would be so grateful for your cooperation in this, my lord. I do so hate to be... disappointed."

effects.description:
Hero action cost: -50%
	(Heroes in local region)

skillTree.localised_description: Egrimm is blessed with the deep wisdom and cunning of Tzeentch himself. In battle he can confuse enemy plans foil their attacks. The Opposing generals are like puppets in a play staged by Egrimm.

effects.description:
Attribute: Vanguard Deployment for melee infantry units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The majority of the warriors who protect the Cabal are willing slaves to Horstmann and his Apprentices. They are ignorant men desperate for the chance to learn a fraction of their master’s skills.

effects.description:

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Horstmann’s Apprentices are everywhere, and nearly two thirds of all the Chaos cults in the Empire are either created indirectly by agents from within his network, are controlled by his Cabal in some round about way, or owe direct allegiance to him.

effects.description:
Unlocks Hero recruitment: Cultist of Tzeentch

Passive ability: "Mark of Cabal" for Cultists of Tzeentch and Acolytes of Tzeentch units
	(Lord's army)

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Chaos Spawn

skillTree.localised_description: The Daemons of Tzeentch no doubt whisperes their timeless secrets into Horstmann’s sleeping mind, and his powers grows strong.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10

skillTree.localised_description: "Do not ask which creature screams in the night. Do not question who waits for you in the shadow. It is my cry that wakes you in the night, and my body that crouches in the shadow. I am Tzeentch and you are the puppet that dances to my tune..."

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: A Chaos Lord dominates – lesser beings cringe from a being that is so intently under scrutiny from the Dark Gods.

effects.description:

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To the Northmen, there is no greater honour than to fight and perish under the gaze of the Gods.

skillTree.localised_description: The worthiest of Chaos' vanguard are blessed with the most elaborate mutations, which also enable them to move faster for longer.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them - this is what Chaos wants.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption - as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.
"This stinking mortal Hold will fall, my masters have foreseen it. Bring them ruin!"

skillTree.localised_description: This willing servant of the Ruinous Powers has a resilience that is beyond any mortal measure.

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

skillTree.localised_description: Visions cloud the mind, prophesising the arrival of the enemy and uncovering every shadow in which they lurk.

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

factionEffects.localised_description: The sorcerers of the Cabal bow only to Egrimm van Horstmann and only because he is the most powerful of them. Van Horstmann's apprentices are everywhere, and nearly two-thirds of all the Chaos Cults in the Empire are either created indirectly by agents from within his network, are controlled by his Cabal in some roundabout way,

effects.description: Cultist of Tzeentch can establish a tzeentch cult in the enemy settlements

items.colour_text: This Runeblade encrusted with writhing Chaos runes that radiate a blue and malevolent power. Its touch is deadly and its bite will penetrate ordinary armour with ease.
Van Horstmann's small magical mirror has the ability to destroy the enemy if only they will look upon its cracked surface...
The Skull of Sorcerer Katam continues to whisper words of power into the ears of its owner.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -15% for Egrimm's spells

items.colour_text: This potent talisman consists of a filigree of witch-hair cradling the fossilised eye of a Lord of Change. It is said to give the bearer a sixth sense that warns him of threats from afar.

effects.description:
Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve change: -15% when increasing
	(local region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "Seek refuge in faith or madness, for there's no longer any other place to hide. The Reign of Chaos has begun!..."

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Giver of Arcane Glory" for Cultists of Tzeentch and Acolytes of Tzeentch units
	(Lord's army)

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each nearby entity death.
